right in pinned mode"},{"name":"description","value":"

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1535551588031"},{"name":"updated","value":"1535983116327"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"pavel.nikitin"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Pavel Nikitin"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Ekaterina_Zaikina"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Ekaterina Zaikina"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-921","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Cosmetics"],"valueId":["Cosmetics"],"color":{"bg":"#b7e281","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 75","id":"YouTrack:sprint 75"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image.png","id":"74-561004","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image.png?file=74-561004&c=true"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[{"value":"regression","cssClass":"c11"}]}, {"id":"JT-48923","entityId":"25-2104117","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"48923"},{"name":"summary","value":"Link decoration is broken for links with icon"},{"name":"description","value":"


The reason is compensating icon position by this styles, which also move underline of icon spacing:

.yt-compensate-top-1, .global .yt-compensate-top-1 {
    position: relative;
    top: -1px;
}
"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1535629101416"},{"name":"updated","value":"1535983116327"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"pavel.nikitin"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Pavel Nikitin"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Natasha.Katson"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Natasha Katson"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"5"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"permittedGroup","value":"jetbrains-team"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-921","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Cosmetics"],"valueId":["Cosmetics"],"color":{"bg":"#b7e281","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 75","id":"YouTrack:sprint 75"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image1.png","id":"74-561367","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image1.png?file=74-561367&c=true"},{"value":"Screen Shot 2018-08-30 at 17.07.26.png","id":"74-561488","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/Screen%20Shot%202018-08-30%20at%2017.07.26.png?file=74-561488&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-3047563","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-48923","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Andrey Skladchikov is it ring-ui problem? Because I remember that Filipp did something special for this link's underline in new version of ring-ui

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1535629651235,"updated":1535629685337,"permittedGroup":"YouTrack Team","markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3047610","author":"Andrey.Skladchikov","authorFullName":"Andrey Skladchikov","issueId":"JT-48923","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Yep, there was some hacks around Link underline, but we turned it off for angular apps, so it is normal browser underline and shouldn't be caused by Ring UI. Could we see how it worked with Ring UI 0.4?
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1535630715608,"updated":1535630796338,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3047636","author":"Andrey.Skladchikov","authorFullName":"Andrey Skladchikov","issueId":"JT-48923","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Caught it! The reason is compensating icon position by this styles, which also move underline of icon spacing:
.yt-compensate-top-1, .global .yt-compensate-top-1 {
    position: relative;
    top: -1px;
}
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1535631512527,"updated":1535631553039,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3047648","author":"maksimrv","authorFullName":"Maksim Ryzhikov","issueId":"JT-48923","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Andrey Skladchikov nice!!! :)
Looks like we have a solution

Thanks!
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1535631809095,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3047960","author":"Andrey.Skladchikov","authorFullName":"Andrey Skladchikov","issueId":"JT-48923","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
There is also an issue with "Add to board" and "Stop watching" links. Please consider if it should be another issue or could be fixed in scope of this issue
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1535638114514,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"regression","cssClass":"c11"}]}, {"id":"JT-48903","entityId":"25-2102819","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"48903"},{"name":"summary","value":"Activity stream loaders do not flash"},{"name":"description","value":"

2018.2.44975

STR:

  1. Turn on new ring-ui
  2. Open any "light" issue, toggle history in activities off.
  3. Open RSRP-80754, wait until activities load.
  4. Toggle history on.

Eexpected result: history icon flashes for the whole duration of content loading (as it was in old ring ui)
Actual result: history icon does not flash and does not indicate ongoing action

build 44922

  1. Open browser, set window size =! full screens
  2. Open Global Settings
  3. Scroll page down so not all selector for "Default Timezone" are visible (as on screenshot). 3/4 of Default Timezone should be visible.
  4. Select new Default Timezone

AR: botton panel are missed

What steps will reproduce the problem?

  1. Add report to dashboard
  2. Try to set custom refresh rate
  3. No "save" button appears

This issue is critical for us because dashboard with reports are used by our emploees all the time.

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1535949153947"},{"name":"updated","value":"1535975328422"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"Ekaterina_Zaikina"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Ekaterina Zaikina"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"dmitriykhlopin"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":" "},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-422","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"Ekaterina_Zaikina","fullName":"Ekaterina Zaikina"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Dashboard & Widgets"],"valueId":["Dashboard & Widgets"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Critical"],"valueId":["Critical"],"color":{"bg":"#ffc8ea","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 75","id":"YouTrack:sprint 75"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-3051656","author":"Ekaterina_Zaikina","authorFullName":"Ekaterina Zaikina","issueId":"JT-48954","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@ if you are using reports of one of these types: "Issues per project", "Issues per assignee", "Issue per arbitrary field" or "Issues per two fields", I can suggest you as a temporary workaround install Issue Distribution Report Widget from plugin repository instead of default report widget.

It has control for refresh-period in the footer of edit form, and this setting can be saved.

please have a look here

green arrow unfolds an issue which is great
but violet arrow does two things
* link to the issue (opens issue in the same location ie: tab in chrome) which is ok
* unfolds an issue which is sensless as it's immediately replaced by opened issue

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1533984477355,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":"YouTrack Team","markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3015534","author":"thomas.klaas","authorFullName":"Thomas Klaas","issueId":"JT-48671","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
unfolds an issue which is sensless as it's immediately replaced by opened issue

this is getting worse while opening in new tab with middle mouse button. You end up having multiple issues unfold.
It is even not possible anymore to simply open multiple issues in new tab unless you start from the last issue and go up the list. This way, the popup won't get in your way while clicking.
